title: TASK_FOLLOW_POINT_ROUTE
content:
0x595583281858626E0xB837C816// TaskFollowPointRoute
void TASK_FOLLOW_POINT_ROUTE(Ped ped, float speed, int routeMode);Parameters:ped: The ped to give the task to.speed: The speed to move at in m/s.routeMode: The route mode to use, refer to eFollowPointRouteModeMakes the ped go on a point route.enum eFollowPointRouteMode {
	TICKET_SINGLE = 0,
	TICKET_RETURN = 1,
	TICKET_SEASON = 2,
	TICKET_LOOP = 3
}
This native is often times used with TASK_FLUSH_ROUTE and TASK_EXTEND_ROUTEExamples:LuaTaskFlushRoute()
TaskExtendRoute(0.0, 0.0, 70.0)
TaskExtendRoute(10.0, 0.0, 70.0)
TaskExtendRoute(10.0, 10.0, 70.0)
TaskFollowPointRoute(PlayerPedId(), 1.0, 0)
codeBlocks:
// TaskFollowPointRoute
void TASK_FOLLOW_POINT_ROUTE(Ped ped, float speed, int routeMode);

local ped = PlayerPedId()
-- Example usage for TASK_FOLLOW_POINT_ROUTE
TaskFollowPointRoute(ped, 0.0, 0)
